thread.title: Guernsey States will not take on another fast ferry after Condor fiasco
thread.title_full: Guernsey States will not take on another fast ferry after Condor fiasco | Channel - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Guernsey States will not take on another fast ferry after Condor fiasco
text:
Guernsey States have said that they are not considering leasing or owning any other ferries if problems with Condor continue.
Deputy Minister of Commerce and Employment was questioned in this morning's States meeting by Deputy John Gollop.
He confirmed that leasing a fast ferry at short notice does not form part of any contingency plan.
Deputy Al Brouard also said that there is a shortage of suitable ships for Guernsey and Jersey's ports and that a back-up ferry could not be justified on commercial grounds.
The Department believe Condor are in charge of contingency plans in case of cancellations and delays.
Some States members also said they are not going to accept any further deterioration of the situation with Condor's services.
Last updated Tue 29 Sep 2015 Travel Guernsey Jersey
